title: Computer-Assisted Language Instruction Design: Project-Based Learning Grounded in the Display Theory of Components

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental computer literacy and intermediate-level target language comprehension
context.additional_context: A course designed to help learners in managerial/leadership roles develop language skills applicable in real work environments.

learning_goals: Learners can accurately analyze and utilize intermediate-level language structures (grammar, vocabulary, pronunciation) using digital modules based on sign theory
Learners can complete language projects reflecting real-world business scenarios through collaboration with peers in PBL environments
Learners can autonomously manage their learning progress in BYOD environments and improve target language communication skills by 20%
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
